content:
advertisement

A renowned pianist honored the work of a nineteenth century Hungarian composer in Happy Valley on Thursday night PERIOD

Enrico Pace played a free performance at the Esber Recital Hall in Music Building I as part of the Franz Liszt bicentennial celebrations PERIOD Liszt was born Oct PERIOD   making this year his two hundredth birthday PERIOD

The Penn State School of Music and the American Liszt Society Pa PERIOD Chapter sponsored the recital in honor of Liszt PERIOD

Pace won the International Liszt Piano Competition in Utrecht Netherlands in  PERIOD He regularly performs at various venues around Europe as a soloist or with orchestras PERIOD

For his Esber Hall recital Pace performed Liszts Pilgrimage Years Suite of Compositions  comprised of nine pieces  and Sonata in B Minor S PERIOD . paces reputation garnered him some supporters in the audience including Michael Marini PERIOD

I heard about him and had to see him or hear him rather Marini freshmanmusic education said with a chuckle PERIOD

He added that he was inspired by Paces performance and hopes that he can play that well some day PERIOD

He really makes you live the moment of the music he said PERIOD

Marini added the fourth composition of Pilgrimage Years  Au bord dune source Beside a Spring  was one of his favorites because it was so calming PERIOD

I closed my eyes during it and actually felt like I was sitting beside water he said PERIOD

In addition to his recital Pace also offered a master class on Wednesday evening in Esber Recital Hall and additional lessons this morning in the Music Building II PERIOD

Chris Orr was one of the music students who went to the master class in addition to attending the recital PERIOD

Orr juniorpiano performance said he attended Paces events when he visited campus a few years ago which made him want to see him again PERIOD

Hes technically brilliant he said PERIOD The way he captures the essence of the music you can tell the depth in which hes involved PERIOD It really comes through. orr added that his favorite part of Pilgrimage Years was the sixth composition Valle dObermann Obermanns Valley because its where the major melody comes in PERIOD

It just sounds heavenly Orr said PERIOD
